name: Novotel Brugge Centrum

reviews.title: Excellent Experience in Brugge!
reviews.text: The Novotel met all of our expectations. It is within walking distance to everything you want to see. Breakfast was included with our stay and it was fresh and plentiful. Brugge is a wonderful place to experience!

reviews.title: Enjoyable break
reviews.text: Hotel conveniently located for the centre of Bruge and its historic attractions. Facilities first class and staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast choice good. Free safe in room for storing valuables, and small frdge holds drinks which can be purchased from off licence or carrefour supermarket accross the road from the hotel.

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: I have stayed at this Hotel several times as a stopover on route to Germany, it is quite simply the best location you could get for the great city of Brugge.

reviews.title: Good, Very central hotel
reviews.text: A public car park is situated below the Hotel with a very modest 8 euros for 24 hrs, try getting that in London!

reviews.title: Great value for families at a central location
reviews.text: Very good hotel in great location. Room was nice and spacious. Hotel was of typical Novotel quality. Breakfast was good but not great ( just small things like having to queue to get coffee from a machine and the fruit was tinned). staff very friendly.

Nice Hotel. Spent one night while on an escorted tour with Gate 1. Weather was a little cool and damp so did not have a chance to try the pool. Easy 10 minute walk to the main square and many restaurants to sample Mussels and Frites! Try then Brugge style...cooked in beer and curry!
reviews.title: Comfortable and Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has the perfect location. It is located in the old part of the city and is a short walk from everything in old Brugge (including a small grocery store right across the street).
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The room was on the small side but had everything we needed (kettle, fridge, safe etc.). It was very quiet despite the number of tourists in the area. The hotel has it's own courtyard which helps keep the noise down.
reviews.title: Enjoyable days in Bruges

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location in old town and beside a parking garage. A super location to use as a base to explore the city without having to use your car. Quiet and modern but in a place of much beauty and history. Lot's of places to eat nearby.
reviews.title: clean, characterless, typical Novotel really.

reviews.text: The lobby is newly renovated and looks great but the rooms are the same old Novotel rooms that you see everywhere across the planet. Tired and out of style, but large and functional. Novotel seems stuck in the 1990s and hopefully someone at Accor is working to put some work back into the concept.

reviews.text: Double bed plus a sofa bed that you can pull out to make another bed. A desk and a tv with good channels in English and French and Flemmish. Bathtub and shower, seperate toilet.

description: The Novotel Brugge Centrum is a 3 star hotel in the historic centre of Bruges, a unique European city known as the Venice of the North. It features 126 comfortable and functional rooms, a bar and restaurant, plus 8 rooms for meetings and conferences and1 large multifunctional room. The hotel is equally suited to business trips and holidays in Bruges with your partner or family, boasting a garden, terrace and outdoor heated pool in summer. Public pay parking available under the hotel.
